page.title: 11THE AIRPORT THREAT
page.content: In 1964 a public meeting was held in Takeley to organise opposition to the proposal to make Stansted London's new airport. The opposition was success- ful and government was forced to drop its proposals. These were revived again a few years later when an alter- native plan fell through. Again public outcry won the day and a second public enquiry went against expansion but the villagers of Takeley and NW Essex had not fully bargained for the tenacity of government who instigated a third public enquiry in 1984. This resulted in the announcement in 1985 that Stansted would be allowed to expand to at first 15 million passenger movements per year and finally to 25 million. This would have to take place within present boundaries and with only the one runway, thus remov- ing the threat of a second runway.
